summary: Warrenton refers to the CIA Record Center location. The Assassination Records Review Board (ARRB) discussed the release of CIA records related to the JFK assassination, specifically those located at the Warrenton Records Center. The ARRB made decisions regarding the release of these records during a meeting on November 17, 1997.
significance: Warrenton is significant as the location of a CIA Record Center containing records relevant to the JFK assassination. The ARRB's discussions and decisions regarding the release of records from Warrenton highlight the importance of this location in the context of declassifying information related to the assassination.
